sub_title: Junior doctor at the ED of the Zuyderland MC | Co-founder at Mens Achter de Patiënt' Foundation and at employment agency SUZY
summary: Idealistic, dedicated and entrepreneurial: I am committed to personcentred care. Whether it is in my role as a medical doctor, as co-founder of the Patient as a Person Foundation or as a PhD student at Maastricht University: I try to make a difference wherever I can, together with others. Willing to make a difference with me? Feel free to send me a message!

education.field_of_study: Nature and Science & Nature and Health

awards.title: Marja van Dieijen Award 2021
awards.description:
The Marja van Dieijen Award is a new prize for innovative ideas, initiatives and projects by employees and/or students of the MUMC+. The jury was looking for an innovative idea that combines the pillars of education, research and patient care and embodies the ambition of the MUMC+: healthy living. The prize is accompanied by a sum of 25,000 euros that can be used to implement the idea. 

We won this prize for our 'Partners in Care' initiative. We have trained patients and their relatives to become 'patient consultants' or 'partner consultants', who can support healthcare professionals in taking over feedback from patients in their care. In the coming years, we will train two departments of the MUMC+ in the application of patient feedback. This is a joint initiative of the Patient as a Person Foundation and the School of Health Professions Education of Maastricht University.

awards.title: Honourable mention Medicine Student of the Year 2021
awards.description: The jury of the Geneeskundestudent van het Jaar 2021-election considers the establishment of Uitzendbureau SUZY to be of societal importance as the initiative offers students valuable work experience in healthcare. The jury hopes that these initiatives will continue to exist after the COVID-crisis and that similar agencies will be set up in other cities.
awards.issuer: Koninklijke Nederlandsche Maatschappij tot bevordering der Geneeskunst (KNMG)

awards.title: Nomination Movisie Thesis Award 2020
awards.description: The Movisie Thesis Award aims to reinforce and acknowledge research that contributes to the efficacy of innovations in the social domain. My thesis, written as part of the Master Healthcare Policy, Innovation and Management, on the active participation patients in education was recognised as one of the top three theses out of the 34 submissions.

awards.title: Nomination Maastricht University Student Award 2020
awards.description: Our initiative regarding the deployment of UM-students during the COVID-19 pandemic in the Maastricht University Medical Centre+ was recognised by and shortlisted for the UM Student Award 2020.

awards.title: Nomination Marc Cornelissen Brightlands Award
awards.description: Marc Cornelissen Brightlands Award is awarded to candidates who distinguish themselves in the spirit of Marc in their collaborative leadership and collaborate across borders to make this world more sustainable. Candidates are able to radiate ambassadorship of this award as well as of Brightlands. Mens Achter de Patiënt was shortlisted from 18 nominations.

awards.title: Young Talent Award in Medicine
awards.description:
The KNMG (Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij tot bevordering der Geneeskunst/Royal Dutch Society for the improvement of Medicine) rewarded the Young Talant Award in Medicine to three medical students from the Netherlands for their societal impact. I was granted this award for my contribution to 'Stichting Mens Achter de Patiënt' (Patient as Person Foundation).

Article KNMG:
https://www.knmg.nl/actualiteit-opinie/columns/column/inleven-in-de-patient.-welke-patient.htm

awards.title: Maastricht University Student Award 2016
awards.description:
For Mens Achter de Patiënt we were awarded the Student Award 2016 by Maastricht University to "recognize outstanding social or cultural achievements by students." Out of nineteen nominees our project was chosen because, according to the jury, it served as a true eye-opener for health care professionals and students.

Announcement Maastricht University:
https://www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/news/prizes-awarded-during-opening-academic-year

Ceremony: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wNG0kEeVaKA

profile_positions.description:
Als arts niet in opleiding op de Spoedeisende Hulp van het Zuyderland Medisch Centrum verleen ik basale spoedeisende zorg onder supervisie van SEH-artsen en artsen in opleiding tot SEH-arts. 

BIG: 19931858001
profile_positions.title: Arts-assistent

profile_positions.description: As an external PhD student I conduct research into active patient participation in education and care. Within the educational part of my PhD, I explore the effects of active participation within the educational module Patient as a Person. In the care part of my PhD I focus on active participation of patients and their informal carers within the activities of the Maastricht UMC+ Patient and Informal Care Academy.
profile_positions.title: PhD-candidate

profile_positions.description:
SUZY is the new student employment agency in the field of healthcare. It was founded by students and works for students: generation Y, generation Z and all the coming generations. We are young, enthusiastic and eager to learn. 

In The Netherlands there is a chronic shortage of health care personnel. At the same time, a pandemic pressures health care systems. SUZY recruits students who are willing to contribute and SUZY in turn aids the students in personal and professional development.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and director

profile_positions.description:
Patient as a Person Foundation (Dutch: Stichting Mens Achter de Patiënt) dreams of patient-centred care through patient-centred education. In the eponymous educational module, students from different backgrounds are matched to people with experience with health and health care. The module consists of three meetings in which health care in general, the story of the patient and the lessons learnt by students are discussed consecutively. Students speak of a key experience and gain insight in the impact of disease. Furthermore, the students develop collaborative competencies through the interprofessional character of the module. 

Not only students learn from participating in the module. Patients report they gain insight in their own disease trajectory, become more aware of the role they have in the professional-patient relation, experience recognition, become more assertive and experience meaning through participation. 

Currently, the module is executed at Maastricht University, Zuyd University of Applied Sciences (Heerlen), VISTA college (vocational institute in Heerlen and Maastricht), GildeOpleidingen (Sittard, Roermond, Oostrum and Weert), Avans University of Applied Sciences (Breda) and Karel de Grote University of Applied Sciences (Antwerp). In the academic year of 2018-2019 more than 800 students participate along with more than 200 patients.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and Director

profile_positions.description: The Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has far-stretching consequences for health care systems worldwide. The rapid developments have not only put health care systems to a strenuous task, but it has also paralysed a significant share of medical schools worldwide suspending most clinical rotations. One of the priorities for hospitals in their preparation for a viral pandemic is maintaining and,  augmenting their hospital workforce. Augmentation of clinical staff can be achieved through acquiring non-traditional personnel such as medical students. During the recent pandemic I have taken up the initiative, together with a fellow student and a resident, to the safe and resource-conscious deployment of medical students in the Maastricht University Medical Centre+. This led to the development of various non-clinical tasks (such as medical scribes, camera monitoring and gatekeepers) for over 200 students. I was responsible for the planning, salaries, internal affairs, educational meetings and peer-to-peer groups. We intend to continue the deployment of students post-COVID-19.
profile_positions.title: Coördinator of medical students during the COVID-19 pandemic

profile_positions.description:
After my term as innovation officer for the Health University, I continued in the expansion committee together with three former board members. The aim of the expansion committee was to formalise the initiatited and developed activities for the coming two years. 

Health University MedSchool is a lecture series for VWO5 students in secondary education to get them acquainted with the study of medicine. In cooperation with Marketing & Communication of Maastricht University, this series is offered to secondary schools in Maastricht, Sittard and Roermond. 

Additionally, Health University In-depth was organised for the second consecutive year in 2019. In cooperation with the Brightlands Maastricht Health Campus attendees gain insight in the scientific development in the fields of innovative imaging, regenerative medicine and precision medicine.
profile_positions.title: Health University: member expansion committee

profile_positions.description:
Health University (Gezondheidsuniversiteit) is an initiative of students in co-operation with Maastricht University Medical Centre+. The goal of the initiative is to improve health literacy in citizens of Maastricht and surrounding areas. This goal is achieved through a series of evenings (five in total) which start off with a lecture from an MUMC+ expert. Student tutors are responsible for the poster-session and the closing tutor-meetings. 

As the innovation-officer I was responsible for the development of the lecture-series (introduction through so-called 'starters' and integration of practical assignments) and initiation and development of external activities in line with the described goal (Health University In-depth and Health University MedSchool).
profile_positions.title: Health University: Innovation & expansion and Vice-chairman

profile_positions.description:
Positive health is a definition of health that goes beyond bodily functioning. It focuses on stimulating individuals' resilience and their capacity to have a meaningful life. The province of Limburg lags behind the rest of The Netherlands on a variety of health indicators and wants to implement this vision of health in all its policies as part of its social agenda.

The Action Center for Positive Health in Limburg tries to help organisations in the province that want to adopt this holistic vision of health. The action center functioned as a networking organisation that connected different stakeholders.

We answered questions from organisations and tried to create connections between organisations that can complement each other in their approaches. As Patient As a Person Foundation has an extensive network ranging from patient associations to hospitals to educational institutions, we could connect various stakeholders. Additionally, learning more about positive health enabled us to embed the concept in the education we developed within the Patient As a Person Foundation
profile_positions.title: Committee Member

profile_positions.description: Teddy Bear Hospital is an annual event hosted by IFMSA-Maastricht and facilitated by Maastricht UMC+. Primary school children (aged 4-6) get acquainted with the hospital accompanied by their teddy bears. Medical students learn how to act towards children in a hospital setting. I have been responsible for the organisation of the event, specifically for finances (1 year) and students (2 years).
profile_positions.title: Member of the Teddy Bear Hospital committee

profile_positions.description: As a second year medical student, I have been getting acquinted with clinical practice and Nepali healthcare in general through this medical observership in Patan, Nepal. I have spent two weeks on the ICU and one week in the Emergency department.
profile_positions.title: Medical Observer

volunteer_experiences.description:
Als een junior expeditielid in één van de expedities georganiseerd door Naar de Top voor KiKa heb ik aan drie expedities deel mogen nemen in de Italiaanse en Zwitserse Alpen, samen met een groep jongeren bestaande uit 5-8 leeftijdsgenoten. Naast deelnemen aan de expeditie, heb ik gedurende drie jaar geld ingezameld voor onderzoek naar neuroblastoom. Meest succesvolle activiteiten omvatten de kerstactie van het Sondervick College met een opbrengst van €29.269 en de 24-uurs lessenmarathon op het Sondervick College met een opbrengst van €10.812.

Tijdens deze jaren heb ik naast veel organisatorische vaardigheden ook veel communicatieve vaardigheden geleerd.

Na drie jaar als junior expeditielid een bijdrage geleverd te hebben aan Naar de Top voor KiKa, heb ik in 2019 deelgenomen aan de winterexpeditie van Naar de Top voor Kika in Schotland, in ruil voor het inzamelen van een geldbedrag voor onderzoek naar neuroblastoom. In 2019 heb ik een bedrag van €6.000 bij mogen dragen. In 2021 heb ik de juniorentocht mogen begeleiden, en heb ik €1.000 opgehaald. 

In het laatste jaar (2022) heb ik deelgenomen aan de winterbeklimming in Schotland én de winterbeklimming in Zwitserland. Dit jaar heb ik €28.250 opgehaald voor onderzoek naar neuroblastoom.
